example.akismet
Class AkismetClientImpl

java.lang.Object
  example.akismet.AkismetClientImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
AkismetClient
public class AkismetClientImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements AkismetClient

A Akismet REST (API version 1.1) implementation. The implementation does not implement the "other" parameter (other server environment variables), as defined by the API as: 

 In PHP there is an array of environment variables called $_SERVER which
 contains information about the web server itself as well as a key/value
 for every HTTP header sent with the request. This data is highly useful
 to Akismet as how the submitted content interacts with the server can be
 very telling, so please include as much information as possible.

Constructor Detail

AkismetClientImpl

public AkismetClientImpl(java.lang.String apiKey,
                         java.lang.String blog,
                         java.lang.String proxyHost,
                         int proxyPort,
                         java.lang.String proxyUsername,
                         java.lang.String proxyPassword,
                         int socketTimeOut,
                         int connectionTimeout,
                         java.util.concurrent.Semaphore connectionAvailable)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Construct an instance to work with the Akismet API.

Parameters:
apiKey - Akismet API key
blog - Blog associated with the API key
proxyHost - Proxy host, or null if no proxy configuration is required.
proxyPort - Proxy port. If no proxy configuration is required (i.e. proxyHost is null) then this value is undefined.
proxyUsername - Username to access proxy, or null if no proxy credentials configuration is required.
proxyPassword - Password to access proxy, or null if no proxy credentials configuration is required.
socketTimeOut - The default socket timeout (SO_TIMEOUT) in milliseconds which is the timeout for waiting for data. A timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
connectionAvailable -
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either the API key or blog is null

commentCheck

public boolean commentCheck(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                            java.lang.String permalink,
                            java.lang.String commentType,
                            java.lang.String author,
                            java.lang.String authorEmail,
                            java.lang.String authorURL,
                            java.lang.String commentContent)
                     throws AkismetException
Description copied from interface: AkismetClient
From the API docs, This is basically the core of everything. This call takes a number of arguments and characteristics about the submitted content and then returns a thumbs up or thumbs down. Almost everything is optional, but performance can drop dramatically if you exclude certain elements. I would recommend erring on the side of too much data, as everything is used as part of the Akismet signature."

Specified by:
commentCheck in interface AkismetClient
Parameters:
request - The commenter request
permalink - The permanent location of the entry the comment was submitted to
commentType - May be blank, comment, trackback, pingback, or a made up value like "registration"
author - Submitted name with the comment
authorEmail - Submitted email address
authorURL - Commenter URL
commentContent - The content that was submitted
Returns:
true if the comment is identified by Akismet as spam, false otherwise.
Throws:
AkismetException - If e.g. failed to connect Akismet service.

getAkismetBaseUrl

public java.lang.String getAkismetBaseUrl()
Get the base URL for the Akismet REST service.

Returns:
The Akismet base URL

setAkismetBaseUrl

public void setAkismetBaseUrl(java.lang.String url)
Set the base URL for the Akismet REST service.

Note: The Akismet URL usually contains the API key.

Parameters:
url - the Akismet base URL

               throws AkismetException
Description copied from interface: AkismetClient
From the API docs, This call is intended for the marking of false positives, things that were incorrectly marked as spam. It takes identical arguments as comment check and submit spam."

verifyAPIKey

public boolean verifyAPIKey()
                     throws AkismetException
From the API docs, The key verification call should be made before beginning to use the service. It requires two variables, key and blog.

Specified by:
verifyAPIKey in interface AkismetClient
Returns:
true if the API key has been verified, else false.
Throws:
AkismetException - If e.g. failed to connect Akismet service.
